TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . The applicant sued a private company for salary arrears .
CARDINAL . By judgment of DATE , ORG in ORG awarded the applicant MONEY ( RUB ) against the defendant company .

CARDINAL . On DATE , both parties being present in the court - room , ORG adjourned the hearing until DATE , which was noted in the minutes . The parties were also notified about the hearing of CARDINAL DATE by post , in accordance with the domestic law . However , the court made a mistake in the defendant company 's address , which never received the summons .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of Arkhangelsk , in the absence of the defendant company 's representative , upheld the judgment on appeal .

CARDINAL . The defendant company applied for supervisory review of the above judgments . On DATE a judge in ORG granted it leave for supervisory review . On DATE the Presidium of ORG set aside the judgment of DATE and ordered a re - examination of the case by ORG on the grounds that the defendant company had not been informed about the hearing of DATE . The ORG found that though the defendant company 's representative was present in the court - room when the district court adjourned the hearing to DATE , the defendant company could not be considered as duly informed about it .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the judgment of DATE and awarded the applicant RUB CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . NORP The relevant domestic law governing the supervisory review procedure at the material time is summed up in the ORG 's judgment in the case of GPE v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL , § CARDINAL , DATE ) .

CARDINAL . Under LAW , in force at the material time , parties to the proceedings are to be summoned to a hearing by a letter sent by registered mail with an acknowledgment of receipt , by court summons with an acknowledgment of receipt , by telegram , by phone or fax or by any other means which can guarantee a record of the fact that the summons was sent and was received by the party .
